Overwatch 2 lack of progression and Blizzard's lies makes this a terrible game. It's insane that OW2 lack of progression and over monetization makes me OW1 lootboxes.

I remember a time when I was younger.

I barely had enough money in my bank account. In the summer of 2016, I had to rely on gamestop gift cards and chump change from mowing lawns just to buy overwatch on my xbox. It was my junior of highschool when OW came out and me and my friends played this game like no other. The characters, the lore, the gameplay, all the cinematics leading up to the games release…
Overwatch was genuinely one of the most fun and unique multiplayer games ever created and gave me and my friends so many memories that we still cherish to this day.

When I was in college, they announced a sequel…

Blizzard said Overwatch 2 was gonna have co-op campaign missions with skill trees and other cool stuff…

Then delays…

Then allegations…(we all know what)

Then, they announce that they’re killing off Overwatch 1…

Then, the game comes out… no ones able to actually play it, naturally…

Once people can actually play it, they forced you to enter your phone number. Except for those using a pre-paid plan…

I try connecting my Xbox account to Battle.net hoping that all the skins I’ve obtained all these years would transfer over… they didn’t…

They remove the gambling boxes for this “fun and interactive” battle pass that you have to buy separately. “But what if I don’t want to give these scumbags any money?” Good question! You absolutely nothing. 
Even the new characters are locked unless you either fork over 20 dollars you’ll never get back or grind 200 hours you’ll never get back to play a healer role, awesome. They try so hard to make you buy this battle pass to the point where I miss the loot boxes more and more each day…

Then, they go on a live stream and have a big announcement for Overwatch 2. One so big it blows my mind. They announce that they’re scrapping the PvE aspect they’ve been hyping up for five years. The purpose of the sequel, mind you. They say that “its too hard to make video games even though its our job. Overwatch will continue to suck out all the joy and creativity in exchange for your credit card number…”

Today, Overwatch 2 is an out of touch pile of crap. Any time I hear news for this game I feel like Nelson Muntz pointing and laughing at this dogshit product. If you’ve never played Overwatch before it became shit, stay far away from it. Ive wasted a lot of time, money, and enthusiasm for this game, and I find it impossible for it to come back and shine like it used to. This company does not respect you or care about your enjoyment. I was unknowingly giving my time and money to a bunch of perverts. If 25 year old me can time travel to when I was 18, Id tell him to play Battleborn instead.

5 Years ago I believed this game would have been an outstanding game for the pvp fps genre, but over the years (Especially in recent ones) it has fallen from the grace it once had due to greed and misuse of it's hard working devs. I wish they could have done better in keeping promises, make use of good feedback and communication, kept OW1 as is and kept OW2 as a PvE type game instead of turning it into a wallet nabbing scheme of a husk of a once grand game of 2017

Overwatch 2 is a good game to play casually with friends every once and a while. 

If you want to be competitive and grind ranked, this is not a good game. If you want to play a game that has some pvp and some pve, this is not a good game. If you want to a game to be a completionist, this is not a good game.

Most of the interest in OW2 were because of the new PvE system they were advertisin but they ended up cancellin that and now you get a lackluster shitty fragmented story PvE mode where you pay per mission. If OW2 has success it will be devastatin for the game industry. Other big titles with PvE campaigns will follow suit and start sellin campaign missions in this fragmented style. I urge you to not buy the PvE mode if you have any self control. This PvE system is an atrocious money grab and should be ignored until they are forced to change their monetization style. 

Right now I believe you pay $15 for invasion missions. But the missions are pretty short and there are only 3 of them? So you are payin $5 per mission but the missions are short and have very borin gameplay. When I say very borin gameplay I mean even on the hardest difficulty its just bullet sponge brainless robots that just walk towards you slowly without avoidin anythin or mixin up their movement or actions and the bosses are kinda interestin but so simplistic its not even fun. I probably wouldnt even play these if they were included in the battlepass and I love PvE content.

Dont even get me started on the battlepass, the battlepasses in OW2 are shit, you get mostly garbage bloat items a few good skins and then the mythic skin for $10 or 1000 overwatch COINS. And instead of givin you in game currency (overwatch COINS) throughout the BP or at the end of the BP they made a NEW currency to give durin the battlepass called overwatch credits and those credits can only be used to buy items straight up in the hero gallery but also they cant buy everythin, so there are many skins they will lock to the shop which you can only buy from them for real money or overwatch COINS. This confusion between coins and credits was worsened because after launch the game had a battle pass which gave you an orange currency called overwatch credits, but to buy things in the shop you need an orange currency called overwatch coins (with almost the same exact symbol as credits), but within the hero gallery (the only place you could use credits) it showed credits as white. -_- Now they made credits white in the battlepass but I cant help but think they did that on purpose to see if they could get away with it.

For me this game is way way way too expensive for how lackluster to content is. There are around 6 seasons a year cause two month seasons so you would be payin $60 every year if you wanted to buy each battlepass, but also remember you are PAYIN MONEY in order to earn the privilege to grind out the battle pass so you also need to dedicate time to grind out the battlepass, and dont forget they made "quests" give less XP which made it take longer to progress through the battlepasses after S1 so that people play their game longer. Now to add their future endeavors they will probably be releasin story content on a regular schedule which will probably be $15 like this one and that will happen multiple times a year. And then on top of that they have a store that sells OTHER skins and items that you might not even be able to get even if you play the game 24/7 and bought all the battlepasses, grinded em out, AND bought the story missions, and grinded em out. It just seems like the OW2 team wants money and they dont care about the game that much, I could've asked a crackhead off the streets of san francisco about how to implement pve in OW2 and got a better result than this. They are sellin PvE as if they are deliverin the product they advertised even tho its just OW1 story events with cutscenes.

[h1] The 12 steps of closure: How to grieve and recover from a gaming experience [/h1]

[olist]
    [*]Pick OW1 as your first FPS to take seriously, feel like a sports ball person by watching OWL
    [*]2000 hours later, come to terms that this is past the honeymoon phase and they aren't the same person you saw when you first met
    [*]Leave them, but think of them occasionally
    [*]Installed someone knew, their name is Val, met many friends met named 'I Miss Her'
    [*]Share a bunch of new experiences and learned new skills, honeymoon phase relived and never looked back
    [*]2 years later OW2 pops up in your feed remembers fondly and decides needs some closure
    [*]Adds to queue but can't leave a review, installs but can't leave a review, presses play and first screen shows up asks to log in with QR code, I'm not here to rekindle a flame and walk away to my bed
    [*]Wake up to the screen I left having 6.5 hours in the game now, closed
    [*]Refreshed webpage and now I can leave a review
    [*]Decided 'they deserve better' and learned how to format with an ordered list
    [*]Post the most effort review for my most played game besides Street Fighter 4
    [*]Leave because Val is calling me
[/olist]
